main event: A bright white flash lasting about 1/2 second was observed moving from north to south directly above the observer at a high altitude.
interesting points: The object appeared to have a trail of smoke for about 5 seconds after the flash.
The object moved rapidly at a high altitude for a brief period.
The witness was an experienced 50-year-old watch commander with high school education, a well-experienced aerial visual observer.
The weather conditions were clear with 10 miles visibility.
No satellite re-entry was detected at or near the time of the sighting according to SPADATS.
